Name: Osirian Jar
Description: This white marble jar is in the shape of the local god Osiris Canopus. The lid depicts the head of the Egyptian god Osiris. The body is in the shape of the canopic jars that contain the viscera of the deceased. The body of the jar is decorated with a high relief of Harpocrates and Isis.The Osirian head is crowned with the Atef crown, the White Crown of Upper Egypt flanked by two plumes. The body of the jar is decorated with a high relief depicting a winged scarab carrying the sun disk between two crowned snakes. Above this are two falcons on a naos, or shrine. Two sides both depict a scene of the god Harpocrates carrying the Ankh sign of life, followed by the goddess Isis.
